text: is a Japanese politician and member of the Genzei Nippon party. She was in the House of Representatives and is now on the Nagoya city council in Aichi Prefecture. == Early life and career == Sato was born in Nagoya city, Aichi Prefecture. In 1983 she finished Junior College of Kinjo Gakuin University and became a kindergarten teacher. In September 2006 she became a secretary to Democratic Party of Japan (DPJ) politician Takashi Kawamura, who was in the House of Representatives. == Political career == Sato was in the Aichi Prefectural Assembly from April 2007 to July 2009. She was in the House of Representatives from August 2009 to November 2012. Sato left the DPJ and joined Genzei Nippon ("Tax Reduction Japan"), a party made by Kawamura. The national part of Genzei Nippon joined the Tomorrow Party of Japan in November 2012. Sato was not re-elected in the December 2012 general election. Sato returned to politics in the April 2015 unified local elections, winning a seat on the Nagoya city council. == References == ==External links== *Official website
title: Yuko Sato
